intro: Bidens polylepis f. retrorsa, commonly known as the backward-facing ironweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in clusters, typical of the genus Bidens. It is adapted to grow in dry, open habitats and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
